item.description:
Give way signs turned around and not clear at junction

item.title: Dumped child's bedroom furniture, 7th June
item.description:
Irresponsible people have dumped their children's unwanted bedroom fittings by the green metal clothing charity pod, next to the Dry Cleaners on Newlands. This rubbish appeared between the hours of 18.15 - 22.25 on 7.5.25. This site has become a regular flytipping spot. Can a surveillance camera be placed here to deter flytippers?

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Station Road, Penge, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Arm chair dumped, 7th June
item.description:
Can it be collected please - it’s half blocking the path
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Stoke Newington Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Cars double parked causing problems, 7th June
item.description:
People who are visiting afrikiko bar restaurant old kent road Se151nx are all double parked in the middle of the road and on the pavements. Restricting people and myself who live here from exiting our car park and turning right onto old Kent and as the road is closed turning right is our only way out. This is every weekend and nothing is being done about it I’ve tried contacting the restaurant but nothing gets done. It’s a joke.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Ilderton Road, Peckham, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Drug usage in stairwell, 7th June
item.description:
The same individuals shoot up heroin in our stairwell in the evenings. It’s very unsettling to move past these individuals while they are shooting up. I understand this is a difficult issue to resolve, however hope there is safe resolution for everyone.
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Hertford Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.description:
Several large items of furniture have been dumped by the bins at the Woolwich Road end of Fingal Street.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 115, Woolwich Road, East Greenwich, London

item.description:

item.title: Anerley Hill SE19 in front of number 2 (ex The Grape &, 7th June
item.description:
Anerley Hill SE19 in front of number 2 (ex The Grape & Grain public house) / Church Road junction has a hoarding around this site. This has a number of flyposters on it at the number 2A (Giant shop) Anerley Hill end. The largest flyposter is for “Tinlicker” which is an event in Crystal Palace Park which comes within the Bromley Borough Council boundary (although the park is operated by a trust) – please enforce anti flyposting event conditions on this event and remove flyposters.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 2, Anerley Hill, Crystal Palace, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Anerley Station Road SE20 at, 7th June
item.description:

item.title: Dumped Sofas on Risdon Street next to the bins, 7th June
item.description:
In the 1st photo the sofa, armchair, drum and the other bits and pieces were dumped there between 12 and 1 this afternoon. The sofa on top was dumped there tonight as I watched them walk past my kitchen window with it. It happens on a regular basis and you the council just allow it to happen time and time again. My question is “what are you going to do about it”?

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Albion Street, Rotherhithe, London
Report on FixMyStreet
